article_title: FIO Report Sets Stage For Sweeping Insurance Changes
article_text:
FIO Report Sets Stage For Sweeping Insurance Changes

Law360, New York (June 16, 2014, 12:46 PM ET) -- The Federal Insurance Office recently released its long-awaited report, "How to Modernize and Improve the System of Insurance Regulation in the United States." The FIO needed to strike the proper balance between advocating and leading important changes to the system of insurance regulation, while at the same time respecting the important and valuable work the states have done in the state-based system of insurance regulation in the U.S.



The FIO has managed to handle this balancing act in an exemplary fashion. The report contains 18 areas...

article_metadata.description: Notwithstanding the Federal Insurance Office's mandate as a monitor rather than a regulator, its recently released report will likely serve as a catalyst for industry and statewide change. Both the states and federal government should consider rethinking their long-held notions regarding jurisdiction and authority and work together to address the many challenges confronting an increasingly complex and global insurance industry, says Philip de Haas of Troutman Sanders LLP.
